title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.58 - Executive Order No. 58: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Kings. [DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.58 - Executive Order No. 58: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Kings. [DAGGER]
State Regulations

Executive Order No. 58.01*
Executive Order No. 58.02*
Executive Order No. 58.03*
Executive Order No. 58.04
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... Article I of my order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (c) thereof to be
subdivision (d) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (c), to read as follows: " (c) without limiting the foregoing provisions, any and
all acts and omissions and alleged acts and omissions by any person occurring
heretofore or hereafter in the County of Kings in violation of any provision of

State or local law and arising out of, relating to or in any way connected with
the receipt, possession, or disposal of dangerous drugs by the Police

Department of the City of New York, its officers, employees, or agents"; Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: December 28, 1972

Executive Order No. 58.20
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the requests of Special State Prosecutor John F. Keenan, and the District Attorney of Kings County, Eugene Gold, Article I of
the order and requirement upon you numbered fifty-eight and dated September
nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby amended by adding thereto a
new subdivision (f), to read as follows: (f) the following criminal proceedings: People
v. Fred Moritt, Indictment Number K-13/1974; People
v. Theodore Mann, Indictment Number K-14/1974; and

People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Index Number K-20/1974; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: September 13, 1976

Executive Order No. 58.21*
Executive Order No. 58.22
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW
YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and the request of the District Attorney of Kings County, Eugene Gold, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (d) thereof to be
subdivision (g) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (d), to read as follows: (d) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation presently pending in
the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Index Number K-109/75; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: December 1, 1976

Executive Order No. 58.23
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK
12224......................................................................................................................... Article I of my order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (g) thereof to be
subdivision (h) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (g), to read as follows: (g) Any and all criminal offenses committed or alleged to
have been committed by any person, relating to or in any way connected with the
death of Everett Scott, Jr., or the wounding of Kevin Ronayne, which incidents
occurred in the County of Kings on or about January 29, 1977: Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: February 2, 1977

the Office of Special Prosecutor, entitled: People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor Case Number K-4/1977; Signed: Hugh L. Carey

of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number
fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby

thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (p), to read as follows: (p) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any

the Office of the Special Prosecutor, entitled: People

People
v. John Doe, Special Prosecutor's Office Case Number 78-0347-K/109. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 4, 1979

Executive Order No. 58.38
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, and the request of District Attorney of Kings County, Article I
of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number
fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby
amended by relettering subdivision (q) thereof to be subdivision (r) and adding
thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (q), to read as follows: (q) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of a criminal proceeding presently
pending in the Criminal Court of the City of New York entitled: People
v. Kathleen

Bolognese, Docket Number K835504. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 4, 1979

Executive Order No. 58.39*
Executive Order No. 58.40
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of Eugene Gold, the District

Attorney of Kings County, and the request of Special Deputy Attorney General

John F. Keenan, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (r) thereof to be
subdivision (s) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (r), to read as follows: (r) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with Odis Horton and the wounding of James Eberhardt on or about

January 26, 1979, in Kings County; and a criminal proceeding presently pending
in the Criminal Court of the City of New York, entitled: People
v. James

Eberhardt, Docket Number K904653. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: February 6, 1979

People

Executive Order No. 58.56
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK 12224......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, On the nineteenth day of September, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, a requirement was made by Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller, embodied in Executive Order Number 58, in relation to the County
of Kings, which requirement has been continued and amended on subsequent
occasions; and
WHEREAS, On the thirty-first day of December, one thousand
nine hundred eighty-one, the term of office of the District Attorney of Kings

County expired; and
WHEREAS, On the first day of January, one thousand nine
hundred eighty-two, the term of the newly elected District Attorney of Kings

County commenced; NOW, THEREFORE, I do hereby reaffirm and continue, effective the first day of January, one thousand nine hundred eighty-two, the
order and requirement, embodied in Executive Order Number 58, and dated the
nineteenth of September, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two, as heretofore
and hereafter amended. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: March 10, 1982

Executive Order No. 58.57*
Executive Order No. 58.58
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of the Special Deputy Attorney

General Thomas A. Duffy, Jr., and the request of District Attorney of Kings

County, Elizabeth Holtzman, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-eight dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (x)
thereof to be subdivision (y) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be
subdivision (x), to read as follows: (x) Any and all unlawful acts or omissions or alleged
unlawful acts or omissions by any person arising out of, relating to or in any
way connected with the subject matter of an investigation entitled: People
v. Robert A. Vaccarello, Docket Number 2K033438 - Kings. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: September 21, 1982

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
1.58

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
